keyPolicies.policyDescription: Since 2010 over 1,000 jobs have been created every single day. In Southampton Test, unemployment is down by 67% over the same period.
1.8 million more pupils are being taught in good or outstanding schools. In Southampton Test, schools have received over £16m to support disadvantaged pupils through our pupil premium.
In Southampton Test, over 5,490 young people have started an apprenticeship.
In Southampton Test, there are now 370 great, local businesses since 2010.

endorsements.endorsement: When he resigned from Labour's cabinet he said of Corbyn: 'you are unfortunately not the right person to lead the Opposition. I hope for the sake of the Labour Party, and the millions of Labour supporters and voters across the country, that you will seriously consider your position.'

quotes.text: When he resigned from Labour's cabinet he said of Corbyn: 'you are unfortunately not the right person to lead the Opposition. I hope for the sake of the Labour Party, and the millions of Labour supporters and voters across the country, that you will seriously consider your position.'

examples: Since 2010 over 1,000 jobs have been created every single day.
In Southampton Test, unemployment is down by 67% over the same period.
1.8 million more pupils are being taught in good or outstanding schools.

I hope for the sake of the Labour Party, and the millions of Labour supporters and voters across the country, that you will seriously consider your position.
In Southampton Test, unemployment is down by 67% over the same period.
In Southampton Test, schools have received over £16m to support disadvantaged pupils through our pupil premium.

Since 2010 over 1,000 jobs have been created every single day.
1.8 million more pupils are being taught in good or outstanding schools.

When he resigned from Labour's cabinet he said of Corbyn: 'you are unfortunately not the right person to lead the Opposition. I hope for the sake of the Labour Party, and the millions of Labour supporters and voters across the country, that you will seriously consider your position.'
Jeremy Corbyn is only six seats away from forming a government.
In Southampton Test, unemployment is down by 67% over the same period.
